content: Hi, everyone! HL7 FHIR Connectathon 25 is kicking off at 4:00PM Eastern / 20:00 UTC today. The IPS Track proposal is here. Apologies for the short notice, but we plan to have a track orientation session during the IPS call today at 11:00 AM Eastern / 15:00 UTC (Zoom meeting). We're looking forward to meeting up and making progress with IPS on the call and the Connectathon over these next few days!

Following the kickoff later today, our first activity tomorrow will be to meet at 8:00 AM Eastern / 12:00 UTC. This is a little earlier than the official start time, but it will be a bit better to get started early for those who participating from Europe and it may help avoid some conflicts with other tracks (apologies to US west coast folks!). We look forward to getting together tomorrow at 8:00 AM - and we'll further plan and coordinate our expected activities over the next 2 days.

@Rob Hausam I was hoping to join the IPS track, but I missed the orientation session and the link to the recording on Confluence seems to be private. Is there a publicly-available version of the recording?

Sure, Ian. Thanks for pointing that out - it hadn't occurred to me that the link might be restricted. The orientation was rather informal, but it may be useful, and I'll definitely get an accessible copy uploaded (I had trouble with the downloaded version before, but I should be able to solve that). I'll post in the chat again when the link is fixed. And we'll be meeting at 8:00 AM Eastern tomorrow and do further planning, as we noted above.
@Ian Bacher The link to the track orientation recording has now been updated on the Confluence page. Hopefully it should work now!

The International Patient Summary Kick Off session is now on the Whova app agenda tomorrow at 8:00 AM Eastern / 12:00 UTC. So join the session from there as we begin our track activities for these next 2 days.
As agreed we planned to meet again in two hours (11 am ET / 17 CEST) . The zoom channel is open.
ping me in this chat if I'm not reacting in the zoom channel :-)
@Giorgio Cangioli I'd be happy to do a quick demo of the standalone validator tool at 11, if people are interested
perfect !
.. close to reconnect to zoom .. :-)

Brief Summary:

  • presented the stand alone FHIR resource validator for IPS resources
  • discussed the errors returned by the FHIR java validator with the IPS sample provided by the interopEHRate project (some of them to be clarified)
  • agreed the next steps
  • next check-point at 13.30 ET

Next Steps:
Continue to work on the IPS validation by using the Inferno tool
Continue the evaluation of the provided samples
Create IPS starting from US core resources (Inferno team)
You are all invited to propose discussion topics and action in the next meeting.
As before the zoom channel is open; ping me if there is anything you'd like to discuss...
..less than 1 hour to the next check-point .. :-)
we are on line :-)

Brief Summary:
we have continued the conversation on the validation, either in term of capabilities (validating a Bundle without declaring the profiles) either as validation policies when the validation is done against profiles not declared in the resources.
we will continue the analysis of the errors returned by the FHIR java validator
the inferno team will work on the generation of IPS syntetic samples

The next check point is tomorrow morning at 9 am ET
..looking forward to meeting you again in about half-an-hour.. :-)
this is the link https://unicom-project.eu/
